Itthakāvati：A village in Magadha，mentioned，together with Dīgharājī，as the residence of the Samsāramocaka heretics．Near by was the ārunavatīvihāra，where Sāriputta once stayed with a company of monks．The village had retained its name for five hundred years （PvA．67）．



The Petavatthu （pp．12-13） contains the story of a woman of Itthakāvati who was born as a peta．
